Key Arguments: The legislation is unnecessary and contradicts the principle of freedom of speech.
Australia contributed to drafting Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which supports freedom of opinion and expression.
The government should address misinformation and disinformation by refuting it rather than legislating against it.
There is a distrust in the government, which is exacerbated by such legislation.
Notable Quotes: This bill is completely unnecessary and has no place in a country that preaches freedom of speech.
If the Federal Government has an issue with misinformation or disinformation, just refute it!
